meanings.definition: The quality or state of being isomorphic.
meanings.sent1: The isomorphisms between the two shapes made them look identical.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study isomorphisms to understand how shapes can be transformed without changing their essential structure.
meanings.sent3: The isomorphisms between the twins were so striking that even their own parents had trouble telling them apart.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the isomorphisms between the two paintings revealed the artist's unique style.
meanings.sent5: The concept of isomorphisms in nature can be seen in the symmetrical patterns of snowflakes.

meanings.definition: A one-to-one correspondence between the elements of two sets such that the result of an operation on elements of one set corresponds to the result of the analogous operation on their images in the other set.
meanings.sent1: The isomorphisms between the two sets allowed for a direct comparison of their elements.
meanings.sent2: Computer scientists use isomorphisms to optimize algorithms for efficient data processing.
meanings.sent3: The isomorphisms in the coding language created unexpected errors in the program.
meanings.sent4: The isomorphisms between the two languages made translation a seamless process.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the isomorphisms between the two systems is crucial for interoperability.
